script_text:
A house high up on the edge of the city, with commanding             
               views. Accessible on one side from the street and on the             
               other side from the desert. The home of Liet Kynes.                  
               Kynes stands on the terrace, looking out at the Harkonnen war        
               fleet in the skies of Arrakis. Her face is grim.                     
                                                                                    
               Her eyes widen as a Harkonnen ornithopter swoops directly            
               toward her -- flares its wings in a daredevil maneuver -- and        
               lands lightly on the ledge in front of her house.                    
                                                                                    
               Duncan Idaho gets out, haggard, and ROARS:                           
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         Kynes!                                                     
               Kynes’s hand goes to the hilt of a crysknife sheathed at the         
               small of her back.                                                   
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         It’s not safe for you here.                                
                                                                                    
               Idaho draws his sword. Trembling with rage. Spits the words:         
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         Will you tell the Great Houses of                          
                         the Landsraad how we were betrayed?                        
                         How the best of them was murdered                          
                         here?                                                      
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     8877..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         I am commanded to say nothing.                             
                         To see nothing.                                            
               Idaho stares at her bleakly as the import of that sinks in.          
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         The Emperor sent us here to die.                           
                                                                                    
               Kynes lowers her head. Speaks almost to herself:                     
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         God created Arrakis to test the                            
                         faithful.
description: Kynes stands on the terrace, looking out at the Harkonnen war fleet. A Harkonnen ornithopter lands in front of her house, and Duncan Idaho gets out.
continuity_notes: Harkonnen ornithopter -> Matches Sc 42AC Ornithopter: Use Scene 1 Duffel Bags | Crysknife -> Matches Sc 37 Crysknife: Note that it's sheathed at the small of Kynes' back. | Sword -> Matches Sc 74 Sword: Use Scene 1 Duffel Bags | House on the edge of the city -> Matches Sc 91 House on Edge of City: Note that it has commanding views and is accessible from both street and desert sides. | Terrace -> Matches Sc 78A Master Bedroom: Use Scene 1 Duffel Bags | House -> N/A: Accessible on one side from the street and on the other side from the desert. | Harkonnen ornithopter -> Broken: None

flags.note: Duncan Idaho draws his sword and is trembling with rage, indicating a high-risk stunt.
Blades (crysknife) and swords are present in the scene.

script_text:
The dark tent is dimly lit by a pale glowtab. Scant beads of         
               condensate form on the tent wall and drip into a reclamation         
               system. Jessica lies sleeping.                                       
                                                                                    
               Paul is looking at his father’s ring.                                
                                                                                    
               He slowly put it on his finger.                                      
                                                                                    
               We hear a signal from the transmitter.                               
               She wakes to see Paul bending over the water reclamation             
               system.                                                              
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Someone is near. You need to drink.                        
                                                                                    
               He detaches the catchpocket and hands it to her: a scant             
               offering of water. She drinks half of it and hands it back.          
               He finishes it. Both look haggard: skin dry, lips cracked.           
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL (CONT'D)                                    
                         Let’s get out of here.                                     
               He picks up a SAND COMPACTOR and turns to the tent door.             
               Opens the sphincter door.                                            
                                                                                    
               A trickle of sand pours in -- but Paul activates the sand            
               compactor: its electrostatic field repels the sand and causes        
               it to pack more tightly. He tunnels toward the surface.
description: Paul looks for a way out of the stilltent, while Jessica wakes up and they share water.
continuity_notes: Tent -> Matches Sc 47BA Tent: Use Scene 47BA Tent for exact match. | Glowtab -> Matches Plastics, Scene 20A: Use Scene 20A Plastic for glowtab effect. | Reclamation system -> Matches Sc 48aA Filtration Device: Use Scene 48aA Filtration Device for exact match. | Condensate -> Matches Water, Scene 65: Use Scene 65 Water for condensate effect. | Beads of water -> Matches Water Drips, Scene 20A: Use Scene 20A Water Drip for exact match. | Water reclamation system -> Matches Sc 48aA Filtration Device: Use Scene 48aA Filtration Device for exact match. | Signal from transmitter -> Matches Sc 95 Transmitter: Use Scene 95 Transmitter for exact match. | Ring -> Matches Signet Ring, Scene 95: Use Scene 95 Signet Ring for exact match. | Catchpocket -> Matches Sc 48aA Filtration Device: Use Scene 48aA Filtration Device for exact match. | Sand compactor -> Matches Sc 51 Wormsign: Use Scene 51 Wormsign for exact match. | sand compactor -> operating: Activated by Paul | water reclamation system -> N/A:  | reclamation system -> N/A:

script_text:
Sand dunes glow in the light of an orange sunset. The twin           
               moons rising in the sky. Silence and stillness.                      
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     8888..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               A sudden movement: a minuscule animal, a DESERT MOUSE with           
               impressive huge ears, climbs a dune.                                 
               The mouse reaches the top of the dune where a faint evening          
               mist is blowing. It stands up in the wind, opening its ears          
               wide like sails: capturing moisture. Tiny beads of water             
               catch in the fine hairs and form droplets. The mouse drinks.         
                                                                                    
               A MOVEMENT IN THE SAND nearby sends the mouse scurrying off.         
                                                                                    
               Paul burrows up out of the sand with the compactor. Looks            
               around. Ten feet away, the desert mouse stands frozen. For a         
               moment they look at each other. The mouse hops away.                 
               Paul climbs out. Reaches down into the hole again and pulls          
               out the Fremkit pack. Reaches down one more time and drags           
               Jessica out. She comes out drawing a trailing strap behind           
               her.                                                                 
                                                                                    
               AN ORNITHOPTER approachs, fast and low. Nowhere to run.              
                                                                                    
               The ornithopter flares its wings aerobatically and touches           
               down light as a feather. Paul bursts into a smile.                   
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         That’s Duncan!                                             
               Idaho swings out of the pilot’s seat. His eyes wide with             
               astonishment and joy. He runs to them across the sand. Throws        
               his arms around them. His voice husky with emotion.                  
                                                                                    
               Tears rise in his eyes. He takes Paul by his shoulders.              
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         Paul. I’m so sorry. Your father...                         
                                                                                    
               Duncan stiffens in realization. Drops to his knees.                  
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO (CONT'D)                                   
                         Sire. Milord Duke.                                         
               He presses his forehead to Paul’s hand, overwhelmed. Jessica         
               lays a loving hand on Duncan’s head.
description: Paul and Jessica are rescued by Idaho in an ornithopter, but the reunion is bittersweet as they learn of Paul's father's death.
continuity_notes: Sand dunes -> Sc 51 Dunes:  | Twin moons -> N/A: Create visual effects for twin moons rising | Minuscule animal -> Sc 90 Desert Mouse:  | Evening mist -> N/A: Create visual effects for evening mist | Fremkit pack -> Sc 95 Fremkit Pack:  | Desert mouse -> Sc 90 Desert Mouse:  | Ornithopter -> Sc 98 Ornithopter:  | Sand -> N/A: Note the specific texture of sand for consistency | Fremkit pack -> None: Paul reaches down into the hole again and pulls out the Fremkit pack. | Jessica -> Wetted: She comes out drawing a trailing strap behind her, implying she was wet.

flags.note: ORNITHOPTER in the 'Stunts' category indicates physical risks like aerial stunts.
High-complexity environment with twin moons, desert mouse, and ornithopter flight.

script_text:
Paul and Jessica clamber into the rear seats -- and find             
               Kynes sitting in the co-pilot’s seat.                                
                                                                                    
               Idaho passes a ration kit back to Paul and Jessica. They pull        
               out water flasks and ration bars, and drink thirstily as             
               Idaho takes the controls and lifts off.                              
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     8899..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         Dr. Kynes.                                                 
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         She’s found us a place to hide.                            
                         And friends to watch over us.                              
                                                                                    
               Paul looks out the windows at the ornithopters flanking them.        
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Fremen?                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         People I trust.                                            
                                   PAUL                                             
                             (to Idaho)                                             
                         Is there anyone else left?                                 
                                                                                    
               Idaho shakes his head grimly. Remembering the carnage.               
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         I listened on the combat channels.                         
                         Gurney gave ‘em hell at Arrakeen                           
                         Landing, but lost the day.                                 
                         They must have landed ten legions.                         
                         Hundreds of ships. There were                              
                         Sardaukar with them. At least two                          
                         battalions.                                                
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         You’re sure?                                               
                                                                                    
                                   IDAHO                                            
                         You cross swords with a Sardaukar,                         
                         you know it.                                               
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         So. The Emperor’s taken a side.                            
                         What says the Judge of the Change?                         
               Kynes looks back at her sadly.                                       
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         My title is hollow. The Emperor                            
                         forbids me to say anything at all.                         
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Yet you risk your life to help us.                         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9900..
description: Paul, Jessica, and Idaho discuss their situation while escaping in an ornithopter.
continuity_notes: Ornithopters -> Sc 2 Ornithopter Model: Use Sc 2 Ornithopter Model for all scenes | Ration kit -> Matches Sc 1 Rations: Use Scene 1 Rations for this item | Water flasks -> No exact match in Catalog, suggest adding Water Flasks to Reference Catalog:  | Dune terrain -> Sc 91 Sand Dunes: Use Sc 91 Sand Dunes for this scene | water flasks -> drained: Characters drink thirstily, implying water flasks are no longer full. | ration bars -> consumed: Characters consume ration bars, indicating they have been partially or fully eaten.

flags.note: Combat and physical risks like combat, falls, or specialized movement (e.g. vaulting) mentioned.
High-complexity environment with significant vehicle coordination (ornithopters flanking the craft).

script_text:
Swiftly the Fremen cover the ornithopters with camouflaged           
               tarpaulins and anchor them to the ground.                            
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         We have to get inside. There’s a                           
                         storm coming.                                              
                                                                                    
               Paul looks: far off he can see the storm as a column of              
               darkness blotting out the stars. At its edge the stars shine         
               blood-red through a haze of sand and dust.                           
                                                                                    
               The Fremen find a subtle marking on the rock. Using sand             
               compactors they dig down until a DOOR is revealed. The Fremen        
               work a hidden latch. The stone slab swings inward, revealing         
               a corridor. Kynes leads them inside.
description: Kynes and Paul enter the hidden corridor as a storm approaches.
continuity_notes: ornithopters -> ORNITHOPTER (Sc 101): Matches type of object in Reference Catalog | camouflaged tarpaulins -> WORM SIGN (Sc 51, WARP FLEET (Sc 72), SAND (COVERING) (Sc 95A): Matches type of object in Reference Catalog | sand compactors -> FILTRATION DEVICE (Sc 96): Matches type of object in Reference Catalog | door -> SHIP'S LANDING BAY DOOR (Sc 26), CHEST (Sc 38aA): Matches type of object in Reference Catalog | storm -> None:  | tarpaulins -> None:  | ornithopters -> None:  | door -> None:  | corridor -> None:

flags.note: Weather effects (storm) and vehicle coordination (ornithopters)

script_text:
A huge circular chamber with a central pillar of stone.              
               Passages lead away to laboratories and other facilities.             
                                                                                    
               Rough-hewn vents open in the rocky ceiling: warm, indirect           
               sunlight shines through some fissure high above. The floor is        
               drifted with sand. Kynes nods at her Fremen escort.
synopsis: Kynes and escort enter research station
description: Kynes enters a huge circular chamber in the Nexus Research Station, nodding at her Fremen escort.
continuity_notes: Passages -> Corridors (Sc 9A): Use Corridors from Scene 9A for consistency | Rough-hewn vents -> Air Vents (Sc 20A): Match Air Vents from Scene 20A for accuracy | Central pillar of stone -> Column (Sc 11A): Use Column from Scene 11A for consistency | Laboratories and other facilities -> Rooms (Sc 22aA): Match Rooms from Scene 22aA for accuracy | Drifted sand -> Sand (Sc 95A): Use Sand from Scene 95A for consistency

flags.note: No high-risk stunts mentioned in the scene text.
Research station set, no indication of high complexity environments like weather effects, large crowds, animals, or significant vehicle coordination.

script_text:
Kynes leads Paul, Jessica, and Idaho through a door. They are        
               accompanied by two Fremen: TANAT and SHAMIR. They enter a            
               wide hall: lights flicker on. They see science facilities on         
               each side: botanical labs, chemistry labs, storerooms.               
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Tanat, will you find stillsuits to                         
                         fit our visitors? Shamir, coffee                           
                         service, please.                                           
                                   SHAMIR                                           
                         Yes, Liet.                                                 
                                                                                    
               The Fremen hurry off with unquestioning obedience. Paul              
               watches this curiously.                                              
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Who are you to the Fremen?                                 
                                                                                    
               Kynes smiles slightly and does not answer.                           
                                                                                    
               Idaho, ever cautious, prowls across the station, peering into        
               laboratories. Hands on his weapons. Kynes looks at Paul.             
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9911..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Do you know what this place is?                            
                         It’s an old Ecological Testing                             
                         Station. They were meant to tame                           
                         the planet. Free the water locked                          
                         beneath the sands. Arrakis could be                        
                         a paradise. The work had begun. But                        
                         then we discovered the spice! And                          
                         suddenly no one wanted the desert                          
                         to go away.
description: Kynes and Fremen guide Paul through a wide hall with science facilities, including botanical labs and chemistry labs.
continuity_notes: Stillsuits -> Exact match from Reference Catalog (Sc 96): Matches Sc 96 Filtration Device, which would also be needed for visitors. | Science facilities -> Generic noun, matches multiple items in Reference Catalog: Use a combination of the following: botanical labs (Sc 38aA), chemistry labs (Sc 38aA), and storerooms (Sc 38aA). | Coffee service -> Matches Sc 90 FREMKIT: Use a FREMKIT to provide coffee service. | Laboratories -> Exact match from Reference Catalog (Sc 38aA): Use the same type of laboratory equipment as shown in Sc 38aA. | Stilltent -> Matches multiple items in Reference Catalog: Use a combination of the following: STILLTENT (Sc 99), DESSERT FLOOR (Sc 89).

script_text:
Duncan Idaho wanders into a lab where DESERT-ADAPTED PLANTS          
               grow under glass domes -- not in soil but in sand. He walks          
               the rows in quiet wonder, hand on his sword-hilt.
description: Duncan Idaho wanders into a lab where DESERT-ADAPTED PLANTS grow under glass domes.
continuity_notes: glass domes -> Matches Sc 97 Glass Dome: Use Scene 1 Glass Domes for continuity | sand -> Matches Sc 95A Desert Sand: Verify consistency with previous desert scenes using same sand type | plants -> Matches Sc 37 Desert-Adapted Plants: Use Scene 1 Desert-Adapted Plants for continuity and ensure accurate growth conditions

script_text:
A square chamber carved from bedrock, lit by glowglobes. A           
               row of metal file cabinets stands against one wall.                  
                                                                                    
               In the middle of the room, a desk with a milk-glass top shot         
               full of yellow bubbles is ringed by four suspensor chairs.           
               Kynes sits at the desk with Paul and Jessica.                        
               Tanat returns and lays two bundled stillsuits and their              
               fremkit on a shelf for them.                                         
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Thank you, Tanat.                                          
                                                                                    
               Tanat exits. We glimpse Idaho taking up a guard position             
               outside the office as the door closes.                               
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Do you know what the Great Houses                          
                         fear most? Just what’s happening                           
                         here. The Sardaukar picking them                           
                         off one by one. Only together can                          
                         they stand against the Imperium.                           
                         Would you bear witness? Testify                            
                         that the Emperor moved against us                          
                         here?                                                      
                                   KYNES                                            
                         If they believed me...there would                          
                         be general warfare between the                             
                         Great Houses and the Emperor.                              
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         Chaos. Across the Imperium.                                
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9922..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         But suppose I presented the Emperor                        
                         with an alternative to chaos. The                          
                         Emperor has no sons. Only                                  
                         daughters.                                                 
               The audacity of his words takes their breath away.                   
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         You’d make a play for the throne?                          
                         You’re a lost boy, hiding in a hole                        
                         in the ground.                                             
                                                                                    
               Paul’s voice cracks like a whip:                                     
                                   PAUL                                             
                         You will call me my Lord or Sire.                          
                             (more gently)                                          
                         Fremen speak of the Lisan al-Gaib,                         
                         the Voice from the Outer World who                         
                         will lead them to Paradise.                                
                                                                                    
               Jessica frowns. Paul is accepting the religious mantle. A            
               dangerous game. She murmurs:                                         
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         Careful...                                                 
               But Kynes looks away, shaken. Her heart wants to believe.            
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Superstition.                                              
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         I know you loved a Fremen warrior,                         
                         and lost him in battle. I know you                         
                         walk in two worlds and are known by                        
                         many names. I know your dream.                             
                                                                                    
               Kynes stares at Paul, suddenly vulnerable.                           
                                   PAUL (CONT'D)                                    
                         As Emperor, I could make a Paradise                        
                         of Arrakis with a wave of my hand.
description: Paul proposes an alternative to chaos and the throne, while Kynes is torn between superstition and faith.
continuity_notes: milk-glass top shot full of yellow bubbles on desk -> Matches Sc 22aaA Glass Domes: Use Scene 22aaA Glass Domes | suspensor chairs -> Matches Sc 104 Master Bedroom: Use Scene 104 Master Bedroom | metal file cabinets against one wall -> No exact match, but could use general Set Dressing: Office Equipment: General note: Use Set Dressing: Office Equipment | glowglobes -> Matches Sc 65 Light Sources: Use Scene 65 Light Sources | yellow stillsuits and fremkit on shelf -> Matches Sc 95 Fremkit, also note: Use stillsuits from previous scene: General note: Use previous stillsuit continuity or create new stillsuit | sand dunes outside office window -> Matches Sc 91 Sand Dunes: Use Scene 91 Sand Dunes | milk-glass top of desk -> None:  | still suits and their fremkit -> None:

flags.note: High-complexity environment: Chamber carved from bedrock with glowglobes and metal file cabinets.
Stunts potentially involved in guard position outside the office (Idaho).

script_text:
Kynes’s Fremen companions -- six warriors, men and women --          
               sit drinking coffee from little silver cups.                         
                                                                                    
               A quiet SCRAPE makes them all freeze like deer. A spill of           
               sand from the vents overhead draws their eyes.                       
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9933..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               We tilt up to see SARDAUKAR dropping through the vents,              
               falling in slow motion on suspensors.                                
               We track them as they fall -- fifty Imperial soldiers --             
               landing lightly on the chamber floor. They look around.              
                                                                                    
               The Fremen have vanished. One of the Sardaukar stoops to pick        
               up a silver coffee cup -- a trickle of coffee in the bottom.         
               He frowns thoughtfully --                                            
                                                                                    
               -- and the Fremen ERUPT FROM THE SAND all around the                 
               Sardaukar, KNIVES DRAWN! They leap into battle like                  
               dervishes, six against fifty. Fighting with superhuman skill.
description: Fremen warriors surprise and attack Imperial soldiers in the Nexus.
continuity_notes: Silver coffee cups -> Matches Sc 7 BENE GERESSIT ROBES (6): Use Scene 7 silver cups for uniformity | Sardaukar uniforms -> Matches Sc 42AD BARON HARKONNEN: Use Scene 42AD Sardaukar armor for consistency | Fremen knives -> Matches Sc 1 FREMAN FIGHTERS (Sc 1): Use Scene 1 knife props for accuracy | Sandstorm debris -> Matches Sc 96 FILTRATION DEVICE: Use Scene 96 sand effects for realism | silver coffee cup -> Bloody: Trickle of coffee in the bottom, one of the Sardaukar stoops to pick it up

flags.note: Physical risks like combat and falls (Sardaukar falling through vents)
Blades (knives drawn by Fremen)

script_text:
Duncan Idaho looks up as one of the Fremen comes in from the         
               Nexus -- and falls on her face, a knife in her back.                 
                                                                                    
               Sardaukar pour through the door behind her. Twenty of them.          
               Idaho looks at them and sees his death. A strange wild joy           
               starts up in him. So this is how it ends.                            
                                                                                    
               He SLAPS the door behind him twice. Draws his sword and walks        
               to meet the enemy.
description: Duncan Idaho sees his death approaching as Sardaukar pour in, but a strange joy takes over.
continuity_notes: Fremen -> Sc 45 Fremen: Matches Sc 45 Fremen.  | Knife -> None: Matches Sc 37 Crisknife. | Door -> Sc 78 Shuttle Door: Matches Sc 78 Shuttle Door.  | Sardaukar -> Sc 93 Sardaukar: Matches Sc 93 Sardaukar. | Duncan Idaho's Sword -> None: Matches Sc 74 Sword.  | Door -> N/A: Knocked twice by Idaho | Knife in woman's back -> Bloody:

flags.note: Stunt involved: SLAPS, Physical risks like combat, and sword fighting.
Props involving blades (sword).

script_text:
Hearing the clash of steel, Paul leaps up and opens the door.        
                                                                                    
               Halfway down the hall, Duncan Idaho stands against a wall of         
               Sardaukar -- his longsword slashing, his shield sparkling.           
                                                                                    
               There are five Sardaukar dead at Idaho’s feet already, but           
               there’s still fifteen more trying to kill him. Swords and            
               daggers snaking into his shield. Idaho fights like a god of          
               war. His blade too fast to follow. There’s freedom in knowing        
               this is his last stand. He ignores the damage he’s taking.           
               But as Paul watches, a Sardaukar sword rams through Idaho’s          
               chest and out of his back. Idaho kills the Sardaukar but             
               staggers to one knee. Another knife rams into him. Idaho             
               kills one more Sardaukar... and falls, dying.                        
                                                                                    
               Paul pulls his knife and leaps forward with a cry.                   
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Duncan!                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         Paul, no!                                                  
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9944..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               She drags him back into the office.                                  
               The Sardaukar advance down the hallway toward them.                  
                                                                                    
               Kynes slams the door and locks it. Paul throws himself               
               against the door with a howl.                                        
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA (CONT'D)                                 
                         He’s gone!                                                 
                                                                                    
               Kynes swings a steel file cabinet away from the wall,                
               revealing a dark narrow passage. She grabs their stillsuits          
               and fremkit from the shelf. Hands them over.                         
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Come!                                                      
                                                                                    
               They hurry through. She swings the door shut behind them: it         
               closes like a bank vault, a thick slab of steel.                     
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               HALLWAY                                                              
                                                                                    
               The Sardaukar reach the Laboratory Office door and find it           
               locked. The lead Sardaukar pulls out a laser cutter to cut           
               through the door...                                                  
               ...and behind them, impossibly...Duncan stands up.                   
                                                                                    
               A sword through his body. A dagger in his shoulder. He sways         
               on his feet as he lifts his long sword.                              
                                                                                    
               The Sardaukar turn. Duncan pulls the sword out of his chest          
               as he walks toward them. Dread fills their eyes.                     
                                                                                    
               Duncan goes to his death with a roar, his longsword blazing.
description: Paul and Jessica escape through a hidden passage as Duncan fights off Sardaukar.
continuity_notes: Duffel Bags -> Matches Sc 1 Duffel Bags: Use Scene 1 Duffel Bags | Steel File Cabinet -> Matches Sc 38aA Chest: Use Scene 38aA Chest | Fremkit -> Exact match from Reference Catalog (Sc 95): Use fremkit from the shelf | Stillsuits -> Exact match from Reference Catalog (Sc 95): Use stillsuits from the shelf | Laser Cutter -> Matches Sc 68 Duffel Bags: Use Scene 68 Laser Cutter | steel file cabinet -> Swung away from wall: Revealed dark narrow passage | laser cutter -> Not present as intended, replaced by Sardaukar's sword in Duncan's hand: Used to cut through the door | door of Laboratory Office -> Locked, then closed like a bank vault: Closed behind Paul and Jessica

flags.note: Stunt: FIGHTING involving combat and physical risks.
Props: SARDAUKAR including swords, knives, and laser cutter.

script_text:
Kynes leads Paul and Jessica swiftly down a narrow tunnel.           
               Glowtabs light up at their approach and go dark behind them.         
                                                                                    
               They come to a fork in the tunnel. Kynes points one way.             
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Follow the arrows. You’ll find a                           
                         desert-rigged thopter ready to fly.                        
                         That storm out there’s your best                           
                         shot. Above five thousand meters,                          
                         they’re mostly dust. Climb into it.                        
                         Stay on top. You might just live.                          
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9955..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         You’re not coming with us?                                 
                                   KYNES                                            
                         It only seats two. I’ll get to the                         
                         next station and report this attack                        
                         to the Landsraad.                                          
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         How?                                                       
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                             (she grins)                                            
                         I’m Fremen. The desert’s my home.                          
                                   PAUL                                             
                         Thank you. Good luck!                                      
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         Good luck!                                                 
                                                                                    
               She disappears down the other passage.                               
                                                                                    
               Paul and Jessica turn and press into the dark -- following           
               the dim arrows that light up before them and fade behind.
synopsis: Kynes leads Paul and Jessica through a tunnel
description: Kynes gives Paul and Jessica instructions on how to escape, but Jessica is hesitant to leave Kynes behind.
continuity_notes: Tunnel -> Corridor (Sc 55aB): Matches Sc 55aB Corridor | Glowtabs -> Lights (Sc 65): Use Scene 65 Lights | Arrows -> Hand Signals (Sc 58A): Matches Sc 58A Hand Signals | Thopter -> ORNITHOPTER (Sc 101): Use Scene 101 Ornithopter | Storm -> DUNES (ENDLESS) (Sc 51): Matches Sc 51 Dunes | Desert-rigged thopter -> ORNITHOPTER (Sc 101): Use Scene 101 Ornithopter | Goggles or protective eyewear for desert travel -> FENCING MASK (Sc 14): Matches Sc 14 Fencing Mask | Glowtabs -> Functional, but only when approached by Kynes and Paul/Jessica: Operational status changes (light up/dark behind) | Arrows (on tunnel walls) -> Present and operational: Dimly light up before Paul and Jessica, then fade behind

flags.note: High-risk stunt involving climbing into a thopter to escape a storm
Weather effect - a storm

script_text: Duncan lies dead, surrounded by nineteen fallen Sardaukar.
description: Duncan lies dead among the fallen Sardaukar.
continuity_notes: Sardaukar -> Sc 55aA Sardaukar: Matches Sc 55aA Sardaukar | Duncan -> Sc 1 Duffel Bags: Matches Sc 1 Duffel Bags | Duncan's body -> Dead: Physical state: Lying dead. | Sardaukar armor -> Broken/Shattered/Burned/Wetted: Nineteen Sardaukar bodies are in a broken/shattered/burned/wetted state.

script_text:
Paul and Jessica enter a cavern where a small ORNITHOPTER --         
               sits in a pool of light from an opening in the roof. It’s a          
               fast, delicate craft compared to the military airships we’ve         
               seen previously: its cockpit a bubble of glass.                      
                                                                                    
               They stow their equipment in the ornithopter and climb in.           
               Paul adjusts the pilot’s seat. Tests flight controls.
description: Paul and Jessica examine a small, fast ornithopter.
continuity_notes: ORNITHOPTER -> Ornithopter (Sc 51): Use Ornithopter design from Sc 51 | GLASS COCKPIT BUBBLE -> Glass cockpit bubble (no specific match found, but similar to Ornithopter designs): Create or modify existing glass cockpit design for accuracy | FLIGHT CONTROLS -> Flight controls (no specific match found): Design and build flight control systems matching the script description | ornithopter -> N/A: no physical changes recorded | equipment -> N/A: stowed in ornithopter, no state change mentioned

flags.note: High-complexity environment: Vehicle coordination (ornithopter)
Specialized production gear: Ornithopter

script_text:
The sun still low in the sky. The cloud-wall of the storm            
               looms apocalyptically near, wild with lightning.                     
                                                                                    
               Kynes emerges from a rocky spire, rigged for the desert in           
               stillsuit and robes. A fremkit on her back. She looks out            
               across the desert: in two places WORMSIGN is closing in,             
               drawn by the active shields nearby.                                  
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9966..         
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               She moves away from the rocks along the ridge of a sand dune.        
               As she walks she takes two MAKER HOOKS from her belt and             
               telescopes them to full length. Surveying the desert.                
               She watches the light ornithopter flown by Paul and Jessica          
               mount into the sky and race for the storm. A moment later,           
               THREE MILITARY ORNITHOPTERS lift off in pursuit. She frowns.         
                                                                                    
               Suddenly THE BLADE OF A DAGGER ERUPTS FROM KYNES’S CHEST. She        
               screams and tumbles down the dune, losing her maker hooks.           
                                                                                    
               A SARDAUKAR ASSASSIN walks down the dune after her with a            
               bloody blade. At the bottom Kynes lies gasping for breath,           
               reaching for her crysknife which has fallen out of reach.            
               She looks up. Watches the Sardaukar come. Sand slipping down         
               the dune face under his boots.                                       
                                                                                    
               He stops, standing over here with a cruel sneer.                     
                                                                                    
                                   SARDAUKAR ASSASSIN                               
                         Kynes. You betrayed the Emperor.                           
                                                                                    
               Kynes hears a sound the Sardaukar fails to notice: a HISS of         
               sand beneath them, growing louder.                                   
                                                                                    
               She begins to pound the sand with her fist, a steady                 
               drumbeat. THUMP. THUMP. THUMP.                                       
               She snarls at her killer.                                            
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES                                            
                         I serve only one master. His name                          
                         is Shai-Hulud!                                             
                                                                                    
               The desert opens up beneath them as a SANDWORM surfaces, its         
               great maw open wide. It devours them both in a flood-tide of         
               sand and sinks back down into darkness.
description: Kynes is attacked by a Sardaukar assassin while observing the desert, but she uses her knowledge to summon a sandworm.
continuity_notes: stillsuit -> Matches Sc 42A Still Suit: Use Scene 42A Still Suit | fremkit -> Matches Sc 95 Fremkit: Use Scene 95 Fremkit | maker hooks -> Matches Sc 38A Maker Hooks: Use Scene 38A Maker Hooks | light ornithopter -> Matches Sc 109 Light Ornithopter: Use Scene 109 Light Ornithopter | military ornithopters -> Matches Sc 72 Military Ornithopters: Use Scene 72 Military Ornithopters | crysknife -> Matches Sc 37 Crysknife: Use Scene 37 Crysknife | dagger -> Matches Sc 74 Dagger: Use Scene 74 Dagger | Sardaukar assassin's blade -> Matches Sc 78 Sardaukar Blade: Use Scene 78 Sardaukar Blade | sandworm -> Matches Sc 51 Sandworm: Use Scene 51 Sandworm | Dagger -> Bloody: The blade of the dagger erupts from Kynes's chest. | Maker hooks -> Lost: Kynes loses her maker hooks while tumbling down the dune. | Crysknife -> Out of reach: Kynes's crysknife falls out of her grasp. | Sand -> Slipping down the dune face: Sand slips down the dune face under the Sardaukar's boots.

flags.note: Stunt involving MAKER HOOKS and physical risks like combat.
Props involving THE BLADE OF A DAGGER and BLOODY BLADE.
High-complexity environment like desert with storm, sandworms, and military ornithopters.

script_text:
Paul pushes the power bar forward and pulls back on the yoke.        
               The little ornithopter’s engines whine as it dashes for the          
               storm, sinking them into their seats as it climbs.                   
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA                                          
                         Jet-flares behind us.                                      
                                                                                    
               Paul looks back. Sees three Harkonnen ‘thopters in pursuit.          
                                                                                    
               He slams the power arm forward. The ‘thopter leaping like a          
               frightened animal across the sky. Ahead of them, the rust-           
               colored cloud wall of the sandstorm. Big as a hurricane.             
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                 SSaallmmoonn RReevv.. ((0066//1199//22002200)) 9977..
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
               Each of the pursuing ornithopters fires a MISSILE. The three         
               missiles track them and close fast. COLLISION WARNINGS whine         
               inside Paul and Jessica’s cockpit.                                   
               Paul banks closer to the cloud wall, watching the altimeter.         
               3000 meters and climbing...                                          
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA (CONT'D)                                 
                         We’re not high enough!                                     
                                                                                    
               He weaves desperately: but the missiles track the ornithopter        
               easily. Closing fast. They’re not going to make it.                  
                                                                                    
                                   JESSICA (CONT'D)                                 
                         Paul...!                                                   
               Paul twists the yoke -- and BANKS THEM INTO THE STORM-WALL.          
                                                                                    
               The storm tumbles the ornithopter like a leaf in a gale. The         
               wings buckle dangerously. Paul closes the aircraft’s wings.          
                                                                                    
               The missiles follow into the hurricane -- and they, too, are         
               snatched from their courses and hurled chaotically away. They        
               explode, painting ribbons of fire through the storm.                 
                                                                                    
               The Harkonnen ornithopters break off: the sandstorm is death.        
               Paul and Jessica are crushed into their seats by their               
               ornithopter’s spin. Sand SINGS against the fuselage. Paul            
               fires jets in bursts. Slowing their rotation.                        
                                                                                    
               Visibility drops to zero. Only the wash of dust over the             
               windscreen and the green light of the instrument panel.              
                                                                                    
               Paul eases the wings open to short stubs, struggling for             
               control -- and the engines die. (Instruments retain power.)          
                                                                                    
               The only sounds are the wind, and creaking metal, and sand           
               scouring the hull. The altimeter still spins: tumbling               
               chaotically, they are rising. Climbing past 4000 meters.             
                                   PAUL                                             
                         I must not fear. Fear is the mind-                         
                         killer.                                            *       
                                                                                    
               Jessica hears him and joins him, in an attitude of prayer:           
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL & JESSICA                                   
                         Fear is the little death that                              
                         brings total obliteration. I will                          
                         face my fear...                                            
                                                                                    
               Paul fights to controls the tumbling ornithopter, flying dead-       
               stick. The engines are out.                                          
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                     9988..
synopsis: Ornithopters in pursuit of Paul and Jessica
description: Paul and Jessica's ornithopter is pursued by three Harkonnen 'thopters, leading to a intense chase through a sandstorm.
continuity_notes: ornithopter's engines -> Matches Sc 51 Ornithopters: Use standard ornithopter sounds and visuals | sandstorm -> Matches Sc 47BA Arakkis Environment: Use reference images for stormy weather effects | Harkonnen ornithopters -> Matches Sc 42AD Harkonnen Aircraft: Use standard Harkonnen aircraft designs and markings | ornithopter's wings -> Matches Sc 51 Ornithopters: Use reference images for ornithopter wing flexure | windscreen -> Matches Sc 95A Cockpit Components: Use standard cockpit components and visuals | altimeter -> spinning chaotically: The altimeter still spins after the ornithopter's engines die. | ornithopter wings -> buckling dangerously: The wings buckle as they enter the storm wall. | ornithopter fuselage -> scoured by sand: Sand sings against the fuselage after entering the storm.

Prop: Harkonnen 'thopters fire missiles.
High-complexity environment: Sandstorm and multiple pursuing aircraft.

script_text:
The Harkonnen Dreadnought still hovers over the great house.         
               Harkonnen guards stationed at every door. In total control.
description: The Harkonnen Dreadnought remains above the house, with guards in control.
continuity_notes: Dreadnought -> Harkonnen Dreadnought (Sc 73):  | Guards -> Harkonnen Guards (Sc 81):

script_text:
The Baron reclines in a high-tech tub filled with a viscous          
               orange fluid. He’s coated to the collarbones.                        
                                                                                    
               One of his cheeks is spiderwebbed with white threads, like           
               cracks in an old painting. The after-effects of the poison.          
               Two teenage SLAVES tend to him: a boy and a girl, both very          
               pretty, in revealing tunics. Both terrified. The boy feeds           
               the Baron fruit from a platter while the girl dabs                   
               tentatively at his craquelured cheek with a medical swab.            
                                                                                    
               Rabban enters and approaches the tub. Averting his eyes.             
                                                                                    
                                   BARON HARKONNEN                                  
                         So?                                                        
                                                                                    
               The female slave touches the Baron with a swab and he jerks          
               away in pain, slapping the swab from her hand. She cringes.          
                                   RABBAN                                           
                         We chased them into a Coriolis                             
                         storm. Winds at eight hundred                              
                         kilometers an hour. Nothing                                
                         survives such a storm. They are                            
                         dead. It is a certainty.                                   
                                                                                    
               The Baron takes a deep breath.                                       
                                                                                    
                                   BARON HARKONNEN                                  
                         So it’s done. At last.                                     
                                                                                    
               He beckons to the slave girl to resume her ministrations.            
                                   BARON HARKONNEN (CONT'D)                         
                         Send word to Giedi Prime to begin                          
                         selling our spice reserves. Slowly!                        
                         We don’t want the price to fall.                           
                         You cannot imagine what it cost me                         
                         to bring such force to bear here. I                        
                         want you squeeze, Rabban. Squeeze                          
                         hard.                                                      
                                                                                    
                                   RABBAN                                           
                         Yes, Uncle. And the Fremen?                                
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                 SSaallmmoonn RReevv.. ((0066//1199//22002200)) 9999..
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                   BARON HARKONNEN                                  
                         The Fremen? Kill them all.
description: The Baron recovers from the poison, gives orders to Rabban.

High-complexity environment: Coriolis storm with high winds.

script_text:
The altimeter reads 8000 meters.                                     
                                                                                    
               On Paul.                                                             
                                                                                    
                                   KYNES (V.O.)                             *       
                         Above five thousand meters, they’re                *       
                         mostly dust. Climb into it. Stay on                *       
                         top. You might just live.                          *       
                                   PAUL (V.O.)                              *       
                         8000 meters. We’re still climbing.                 *       
                                                                                    
               Dust has penetrated the cockpit. It swirls across the deck   *       
               and hangs in the air, laden with spice -- orange motes       *       
               drifting before his eyes. Jessica coughs in the dust.        *       
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL (V.O.)                              *       
                         I’ll need to time the top of the                   *       
                         vortex. I can see it. It will be                   *       
                         there... In few seconds... I can                   *       
                         see it....                                         *       
               Paul opens the wings. It takes all his strength. They creak          
               and whine -- but they unfurl.
description: Paul navigates the ornithopter through a dust storm, trying to reach the top of the vortex.
continuity_notes: Dust -> Sc 104 Desert-Adapted Plants (for dust depiction): Use Sc 104 for depiction of desert dust | Orange motes in air -> None, create gap filling note: Create new item for orange motes in air | Cockpit deck -> Sc 22aA Castle Corridor (for cockpit floor): Use Sc 22aA for cockpit floor layout | Wings -> None, create gap filling note: Create new item for aircraft wings | coughing -> N/A: Jessica coughs in the dust. | wings -> Unfurling, with creaking and whining sound: Paul opens the wings. It takes all his strength. They creak and whine -- but they unfurl.

Specialized production gear needed for handling weather effects (drones possibly?) and complex vehicle coordination (ornithopter).

script_text:
The little ornithopter breaks out of the vast storm, miles           
               up. Banking away from the hurricane into blue skies.                 
                                                                                    
               The aircraft’s glass bubble has been scoured to a milky              
               translucence by dust. The wings are bent and trembling. The          
               engines choked by dust compacted hard as concrete.                   
               The ornithopter is a glider now.
description: The little ornithopter breaks out of the vast storm, banking away from the hurricane into blue skies. The aircraft's glass bubble has been scoured to a milky translucence by dust.
continuity_notes: ornithopter -> Ornithopter (Sc 51): Match glass bubble damage to Sc 51 | wings -> Wings of Ornithopter (Sc 51): Bent and trembling wings match Sc 51 | engines -> Engines of Ornithopter (Sc 51): Dust compacted hard as concrete matches Sc 51 | ornithopter's wings -> Bent and trembling: Wings are bent and trembling due to the storm. | ornithopter's engines -> Choked by dust compacted hard as concrete: Engines are choked by dust, making them less functional. | ornithopter's glass bubble -> Scoured to a milky translucence by dust: Glass bubble is damaged due to exposure to dust and storm conditions.

flags.note: The ornithopter is a glider now with bent and trembling wings.
Weather effects: The aircraft has broken out of the vast storm, miles up.
Specialized production gear like drone footage is not explicitly mentioned but a bird's eye view is given.

script_text:
Descending silently and swiftly, Paul sees warning lights            
               multiply across his instrument panels as systems fail.               
                                                                                    
                                   PAUL                                             
                         As soon as we’re down, run for the                         
                         rocks.                                                     
               Jessica nods, bracing herself against the fuselage.                  
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                  GGoollddeenn RReevv.. ((0066//1122//2200)) 110000..
description: Paul and Jessica prepare for crash landing. Paul sees warning lights on instrument panels.
continuity_notes: instrument panels -> Matches Sc 42AD Harkonnen Panel: Use Scene 42AD Panel | fuselage -> Exact match from Reference Catalog: Use Sc 95A Fuselage
